verses.roman:
sa vā āṅgiraso brahman
śrutvā suta-vilāpanam
unmīlya śanakair netre
dṛṣṭvā cāṁse mṛtoragam

synonyms: saḥ—he; vai—also; āṅgirasaḥ—the ṛṣi born in the family of Aṅgirā; brahman—O Śaunaka; śrutvā—on hearing; suta—his son; vilāpanam—crying in distress; unmīlya—opening; śanakaiḥ—gradually; netre—by the eyes; dṛṣṭvā—by seeing; ca—also; aṁse—on the shoulder; mṛta—dead; uragam—snake.
translation: O brāhmaṇas, the ṛṣi, who was born in the family of Aṅgirā Muni, hearing his son crying, gradually opened his eyes and saw the dead snake around his neck.
